questions.question: I can’t let this …………………….
questions.description: Let is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: Mother suggested ……………………….. for that job.
questions.description: Suggest is followed by a that-clause or an ing form.

questions.question: You ought .................. your ways.
questions.description: Ought is followed by a to-infinitive.

questions.question: They made him ………………………… the whole story.
questions.description: When made is used in the active voice, it is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: He was made …………………………. the whole story.
questions.description: When made is in the passive voice, it is followed by an infinitive with to.

questions.question: He is capable ……………………. his own decisions.
questions.description: Capable is followed by of + ing form.

questions.question: You must not ……………………… without my permission.
questions.description: The infinitive is used without to after modals.

questions.question: Don’t forget ……………………….. the money.
questions.description: Forget is followed by an infinitive with to.

questions.question: She doesn’t need ………………………
questions.description: When need is used as an ordinary verb, it is followed by an infinitive with to.

questions.question: You need not ……………………….
questions.description: When need is an auxiliary verb, it is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: I heard them …………………………..
questions.description: The verb is hear is followed by an ing form or an infinitive without to.

questions.question: I saw him ………………………… the lamp.
questions.description: See is followed by an ing form or an infinitive without to.
